metadata.title: What are the requirements for the development environment in which emWin can be used? If sample code is provided, please tell me where it is available.

sections.content:
Question:
What are the requirements for the development environment in which emWin can be used? If sample code is provided, please tell me where it is available.
Answer:
We provide the following environment, application note, and sample code:
Development environment:
The development environment consists of e2 studio, QE for Display, a compiler, and FIT modules. Use the latest versions of these components.
[e2 studio]
https://www.renesas.com/es/un/software-tool/e-studio#overview
[QE for Display [RX/RA] (e2 studio plugin)]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/software-tool/qe-display-development-assistance-tool-display-applications
Note: Although you can download the QE for Display [RX/RA] plugin from the preceding URL, you can also install it from the e2 studio installer.
[Board]
• RX72N Envision Kit
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/products/microcontrollers-microprocessors/rx-32-bit-performance-efficiency-mcus/rx72n-envision-kit-rx72n-envision-kit
• Renesas Starter Kit+ for RX72N
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/products/microcontrollers-microprocessors/rx-32-bit-performance-efficiency-mcus/rx72n-starter-kit-plus-renesas-starter-kit-rx72n
• RX-Family-Target-Board
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/products/microcontrollers-microprocessors/rx-32-bit-performance-efficiency-mcus/rx-family-target-board-target-board-rx-family
Reference materials:
• QE for Display [RX] Application Note
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/apn/rx-family-qe-display-rx-application-note
• RX Family QE for Display GUI Display Application Development Guide using Serial Connection LCD
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/apn/rx-family-qe-display-gui-display-application-development-guide-using-serial-connection-lcd
Note: This document describes a procedure for displaying a simple window by using QE and emWin or AppWizard.
• Sample video for GUI development using QE for Display [RX] and the emWin library
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/video/easy-gui-development-using-qe-display?rxsw-j
For details about how to design a graphical user interface by using emWin and how to use AppWizard, contact Segger, which developed emWin.
https://www.segger.com/
The Wikipedia article provided by Segger and videos provided by third parties are also available as reference materials.
Even though different devices are used in these reference materials, almost the same operation procedures are applicable.
Note that how to specify settings might differ depending on the version of AppWizard.
https://wiki.segger.com/emWin
https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=emwin+renesas+segger
Sample programs:
[Segger's emWin webpage for the RX family]
https://www.segger.com/products/user-interface/emwin/add-ons/emwin-support-renesas-rx-mcu/
Note: These sample programs are applicable to the Renesas RX65N or RX72N Envision Kit. 
These sample programs have a configuration that is different from the configuration in which QE for Display or a Renesas emWin FIT module is used. Use the “Application” folder of each sample as the main reference material.
[Segger’s emWin Samples]
https://wiki.segger.com/emWin_Examples
Note: These sample programs use API programming
[Sample program for displaying images on a WVGA display using internal memory in the RX family (Rev. 1.00)]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/scd/rx-family-sample-program-using-chip-memory-display-images-wvga-display-rev100-sample-code
[RX Family GUI Sample Program using Serial LCD and emWin Library]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/scd/rx-family-gui-sample-program-using-serial-lcd-and-emwin-library
[emWin FIT module]
You can download an emWin FIT module bundled with a training document: 
FITModules\r_emwin_rx_vX.XX_XXX.zip
When this file is unzipped, the training document is available in the following folder: r_emwin_rx\doc\Training
Suitable Products
RX Family
  日本語

Question:
What are the requirements for the development environment in which emWin can be used? If sample code is provided, please tell me where it is available.
Answer:
We provide the following environment, application note, and sample code:
Development environment:
The development environment consists of e2 studio, QE for Display, a compiler, and FIT modules. Use the latest versions of these components.
[e2 studio]
https://www.renesas.com/es/un/software-tool/e-studio#overview
[QE for Display [RX/RA] (e2 studio plugin)]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/software-tool/qe-display-development-assistance-tool-display-applications
Note: Although you can download the QE for Display [RX/RA] plugin from the preceding URL, you can also install it from the e2 studio installer.
[Board]
• RX72N Envision Kit
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/products/microcontrollers-microprocessors/rx-32-bit-performance-efficiency-mcus/rx72n-envision-kit-rx72n-envision-kit
• Renesas Starter Kit+ for RX72N
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/products/microcontrollers-microprocessors/rx-32-bit-performance-efficiency-mcus/rx72n-starter-kit-plus-renesas-starter-kit-rx72n
• RX-Family-Target-Board
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/products/microcontrollers-microprocessors/rx-32-bit-performance-efficiency-mcus/rx-family-target-board-target-board-rx-family
Reference materials:

Note: This document describes a procedure for displaying a simple window by using QE and emWin or AppWizard.
• Sample video for GUI development using QE for Display [RX] and the emWin library

For details about how to design a graphical user interface by using emWin and how to use AppWizard, contact Segger, which developed emWin.
https://www.segger.com/
The Wikipedia article provided by Segger and videos provided by third parties are also available as reference materials.
Even though different devices are used in these reference materials, almost the same operation procedures are applicable.
Note that how to specify settings might differ depending on the version of AppWizard.
https://wiki.segger.com/emWin
https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=emwin+renesas+segger
Sample programs:
[Segger's emWin webpage for the RX family]
https://www.segger.com/products/user-interface/emwin/add-ons/emwin-support-renesas-rx-mcu/
Note: These sample programs are applicable to the Renesas RX65N or RX72N Envision Kit. 
These sample programs have a configuration that is different from the configuration in which QE for Display or a Renesas emWin FIT module is used. Use the “Application” folder of each sample as the main reference material.
[Segger’s emWin Samples]
https://wiki.segger.com/emWin_Examples
Note: These sample programs use API programming
[Sample program for displaying images on a WVGA display using internal memory in the RX family (Rev. 1.00)]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/scd/rx-family-sample-program-using-chip-memory-display-images-wvga-display-rev100-sample-code
[RX Family GUI Sample Program using Serial LCD and emWin Library]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/scd/rx-family-gui-sample-program-using-serial-lcd-and-emwin-library
[emWin FIT module]
You can download an emWin FIT module bundled with a training document: 
FITModules\r_emwin_rx_vX.XX_XXX.zip
When this file is unzipped, the training document is available in the following folder: r_emwin_rx\doc\Training
Suitable Products
RX Family

We provide the following environment, application note, and sample code:
Development environment:
The development environment consists of e2 studio, QE for Display, a compiler, and FIT modules. Use the latest versions of these components.
[e2 studio]
https://www.renesas.com/es/un/software-tool/e-studio#overview
[QE for Display [RX/RA] (e2 studio plugin)]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/software-tool/qe-display-development-assistance-tool-display-applications
Note: Although you can download the QE for Display [RX/RA] plugin from the preceding URL, you can also install it from the e2 studio installer.
[Board]
• RX72N Envision Kit
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/products/microcontrollers-microprocessors/rx-32-bit-performance-efficiency-mcus/rx72n-envision-kit-rx72n-envision-kit
• Renesas Starter Kit+ for RX72N

• RX-Family-Target-Board

Reference materials:
• QE for Display [RX] Application Note
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/apn/rx-family-qe-display-rx-application-note
• RX Family QE for Display GUI Display Application Development Guide using Serial Connection LCD
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/apn/rx-family-qe-display-gui-display-application-development-guide-using-serial-connection-lcd
Note: This document describes a procedure for displaying a simple window by using QE and emWin or AppWizard.
• Sample video for GUI development using QE for Display [RX] and the emWin library
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/video/easy-gui-development-using-qe-display?rxsw-j
For details about how to design a graphical user interface by using emWin and how to use AppWizard, contact Segger, which developed emWin.
https://www.segger.com/
The Wikipedia article provided by Segger and videos provided by third parties are also available as reference materials.
Even though different devices are used in these reference materials, almost the same operation procedures are applicable.
Note that how to specify settings might differ depending on the version of AppWizard.
https://wiki.segger.com/emWin
https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=emwin+renesas+segger
Sample programs:
[Segger's emWin webpage for the RX family]
https://www.segger.com/products/user-interface/emwin/add-ons/emwin-support-renesas-rx-mcu/
Note: These sample programs are applicable to the Renesas RX65N or RX72N Envision Kit. 
These sample programs have a configuration that is different from the configuration in which QE for Display or a Renesas emWin FIT module is used. Use the “Application” folder of each sample as the main reference material.
[Segger’s emWin Samples]
https://wiki.segger.com/emWin_Examples
Note: These sample programs use API programming
[Sample program for displaying images on a WVGA display using internal memory in the RX family (Rev. 1.00)]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/scd/rx-family-sample-program-using-chip-memory-display-images-wvga-display-rev100-sample-code
[RX Family GUI Sample Program using Serial LCD and emWin Library]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/scd/rx-family-gui-sample-program-using-serial-lcd-and-emwin-library
[emWin FIT module]
You can download an emWin FIT module bundled with a training document: 
FITModules\r_emwin_rx_vX.XX_XXX.zip
When this file is unzipped, the training document is available in the following folder: r_emwin_rx\doc\Training
We provide the following environment, application note, and sample code:
Development environment:
The development environment consists of e2 studio, QE for Display, a compiler, and FIT modules. Use the latest versions of these components.

[e2 studio]
https://www.renesas.com/es/un/software-tool/e-studio#overview

[QE for Display [RX/RA] (e2 studio plugin)]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/software-tool/qe-display-development-assistance-tool-display-applications
Note: Although you can download the QE for Display [RX/RA] plugin from the preceding URL, you can also install it from the e2 studio installer.
[Board]

For details about how to design a graphical user interface by using emWin and how to use AppWizard, contact Segger, which developed emWin.
https://www.segger.com/

The Wikipedia article provided by Segger and videos provided by third parties are also available as reference materials.
Even though different devices are used in these reference materials, almost the same operation procedures are applicable.
Note that how to specify settings might differ depending on the version of AppWizard.
https://wiki.segger.com/emWin
https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=emwin+renesas+segger
Sample programs:

[Segger's emWin webpage for the RX family]
https://www.segger.com/products/user-interface/emwin/add-ons/emwin-support-renesas-rx-mcu/
Note: These sample programs are applicable to the Renesas RX65N or RX72N Envision Kit. 
These sample programs have a configuration that is different from the configuration in which QE for Display or a Renesas emWin FIT module is used. Use the “Application” folder of each sample as the main reference material.

[Segger’s emWin Samples]
https://wiki.segger.com/emWin_Examples
Note: These sample programs use API programming

[Sample program for displaying images on a WVGA display using internal memory in the RX family (Rev. 1.00)]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/scd/rx-family-sample-program-using-chip-memory-display-images-wvga-display-rev100-sample-code

[RX Family GUI Sample Program using Serial LCD and emWin Library]
https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/scd/rx-family-gui-sample-program-using-serial-lcd-and-emwin-library

[emWin FIT module]
You can download an emWin FIT module bundled with a training document: 
FITModules\r_emwin_rx_vX.XX_XXX.zip
